messages.message: Hello germany! I figured we should open up talks

messages.message: Yes, most certainly. I would very much like to work with you against Russia to keep him from dominating the North, and working against France together would also be great. E/G is one of my favorite alliances to play.

messages.message: As a western power I usually stay undecided as to who I really want to work with during the first year. But generally speaking I prefer an E/G over an F/G or E/F. It just makes dealing with Russia so much easier.

messages.message:
Okay so several countries have come to me saying that you are painting me as not wanting to work with you. That's entirely false. I have made 0 moves against you. You have attacked me. I have asked for your help against Russia, you said you would only do it if I somehow got France to help.
From my point of view I have done everything in my power to work with you, and you are spurning me at any chance you get.
Please stop working against me. Please stop spreading false ideas about me. Is there something I did to personally offend you?
messages.input:
My response to ENGLAND:'Okay so several countries have come to me saying that you are painting me as not wanting to work with you. That's entirely false. I have made 0 moves against you. You have attacked me. I have asked for your help against Russia, you said you would only do it if I somehow got France to help.
From my point of view I have done everything in my power to work with you, and you are spurning me at any chance you get.
Please stop working against me. Please stop spreading false ideas about me. Is there something I did to personally offend you?'.

messages.message: I am not trying to spread lies, I genuinely feel as though you have no interest in working with me. I was under the impression that you said that it was “too late” for us to work together. England/Germany/France is always a 2 on 1, usually with England choosing their side. I played both and decided to go with France mainly because their plan and communication felt better. I chose wrong, and I am paying dearly for it. I apologize for doing so. At this point it feels as though you are working with France, which is inherently against me. If I have read that wrong then I apologize, but for those reasons I could not just go against Russia because in doing so I would cause a 3 on 1. That is why I asked you to get France off of me in exchange, it is the only way I survive. Otherwise it doesn’t make a difference to me if I lose and France wins or I lose and Russia wins.
messages.input: Message from ENGLAND:'I am not trying to spread lies, I genuinely feel as though you have no interest in working with me. I was under the impression that you said that it was “too late” for us to work together. England/Germany/France is always a 2 on 1, usually with England choosing their side. I played both and decided to go with France mainly because their plan and communication felt better. I chose wrong, and I am paying dearly for it. I apologize for doing so. At this point it feels as though you are working with France, which is inherently against me. If I have read that wrong then I apologize, but for those reasons I could not just go against Russia because in doing so I would cause a 3 on 1. That is why I asked you to get France off of me in exchange, it is the only way I survive. Otherwise it doesn’t make a difference to me if I lose and France wins or I lose and Russia wins.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. England's explanation provides insights into their perspective and reasoning behind their actions, illustrating a genuine effort to communicate and clarify their decisions. The acknowledgment of past misjudgments and the apology indicate a willingness to rectify misunderstandings and potentially reassess the diplomatic relationships in the game. It's advisable to consider England's sentiments and possibly explore opportunities for collaboration moving forward if deemed beneficial for your strategic objectives.

messages.message: I am honestly sorry for how our game has started, and I am proposing an alliance between the two of us. I know that it will be hard for you to trust me, but I think that you can see that it is my only option, and so to betray you again would be short sighted and suicidal. If you can’t trust me, then I have no choice but to hope russia wants me as his sidekick given my navel power. I don’t want that to be my role in this game, so I hope that you will consider my proposal.

England's indication that Russia might fill the Baltic Sea and the expectation of getting into Berlin this turn suggest a complex and potentially risky situation. It's crucial to assess the potential moves by Russia and carefully consider the implications for your own positioning and alliances as you navigate the evolving dynamics of the game.

messages.message: Where are you supposed to be supporting him from?
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'Where are you supposed to be supporting him from?'.

messages.message: Oh... Bal
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'Oh... Bal'.

messages.message: Yep, obviously I will not though
messages.input: Message from ENGLAND:'Yep, obviously I will not though'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. England's statement that they will not support Russia into Berlin despite the initial expectation from Russia indicates a commitment to their current alliance or understanding with you. This declaration reinforces the cooperative relationship and aligns with the discussions around potential collaboration between you and England. It suggests a continued sense of trust and cooperation in your interactions with England.

messages.message: Okay, yeah, this is good. I think going to Sweden will work best then.
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'Okay, yeah, this is good. I think going to Sweden will work best then.'.

messages.message: Just waiting to hear back from France now
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'Just waiting to hear back from France now'.

messages.message: Same

messages.output: Given the consistent and cooperative tone of the recent messages between you and England, with a shared understanding and communication about potential moves and strategies, you should trust the message from England. The alignment in waiting for France's response indicates a synchronized approach and a mutual investment in coordinating actions effectively in the game.

messages.message: Well, Russia has a disband and we both kept our SCs this year, so that's good news. France unfortunately still seems intent on attacking you, he never responded to my last message
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'Well, Russia has a disband and we both kept our SCs this year, so that's good news. France unfortunately still seems intent on attacking you, he never responded to my last message'.

messages.message: Russia offered me support into Denmark. No doubt still trying to take Berlin, or maybe trying to get Norway
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'Russia offered me support into Denmark. No doubt still trying to take Berlin, or maybe trying to get Norway'.

messages.message: Yeah this France thing is getting annoying

messages.output: You should trust the message. This shared sentiment could be an opportunity to strengthen your alliance and collaborate more effectively against the common threat posed by France.
